Kominfo Gandeng Komunitas Lakukan Deradikalisasi
03 Nov 2019, 04:48 by Siska Nirmala
JAKARTA, (PR).- Sekretaris Jenderal Kementerian Komunikasi dan Informatika (Kominfo) Niken Widiastuti mengatakan Kominfo telah bekerjasama dengan berbagai komunitas dalam upaya melakukan deradikalisasi.
"Kita bekerja sama dengan banyak sekali komunitas dalam siberkreasi, kemudian komunitas-komunitas generasi muda yang kita ajak untuk bersama-sama melakukan deradikalisasi kepada masyarakat," ujar Niken ditemui usai acara "Merajut Kebangsaan Melalui Keterbukaan Informasi" di Jakarta, Minggu, 3 November 2019, seperti dilansir Kantor Berita Antara.
Selain itu, Kementerian Kominfo juga menyelenggarakan pertunjukan-pertunjukan rakyat, seperti wayang, ketoprak, maupun pertunjukan rakyat di berbagai daerah di Indonesia yang disesuaikan dengan pendekatan lokal.
"Karena pesan-pesan tentang deradikalisasi itu akan mudah diserap oleh masyarakat apabila melalui tontonan maupun tuntunan," kata Niken.
Niken juga berharap agar masyarakat terus waspada, terlebih radikalisasi saat ini banyak disebarkan melalui media sosial.
"Oleh karena itu kita harus waspada apabila ada konten-konten di media sosial yang isinya ajakan-ajakan untuk provokasi menghasut, kemudian membenci suku tertentu, agama tertentu," kata dia.
Menurut Niken, tanda-tanda tersebut merupakan awal mula dari radikalisasi, di mana tumbuh sikap intoleran, tidak mau menghargai orang lain dan tidak mau saling menghormati.
"Untuk itu, kita harus menyadari bahwa Indonesia ini adalah Bhinneka Tunggal Ika, banyak suku, banyak agama, banyak ras, banyak golongan yang hidup bersama, karena itulah Indonesia, kita perlu bergandeng tangan menjaga kesatuan dan persatuan bangsa," ujar Niken.***

Kominfo Cooperates with Community to Perform Deradicalisation
03 Nov 2019, 04:48 by Siska Nirmala
JAKARTA, (PR) .- Secretary General of the Ministry of Communication and Information Technology (Kominfo) Niken Widiastuti said that the Ministry of Communication and Information has collaborated with various communities in efforts to deradicalize.
"We work together with many communities in creation, then the young generation communities that we invite to jointly de-radicalize the community," Niken said after the "Knitting Nationality through Information Openness" event in Jakarta, Sunday, November 3, 2019 , as reported by the Antara News Agency.
In addition, the Ministry of Communication and Information Technology also holds folk performances, such as puppets, ketoprak, and folk performances in various regions in Indonesia that are adapted to the local approach.
"Because the messages about deradicalization will be easily absorbed by the public if through spectacle or guidance," Niken said.
Niken also hopes that the community continues to be vigilant, especially when radicalization is currently being spread through social media.
"Therefore we must be vigilant if there are contents on social media whose contents are invitations to provoke provocation, then hate certain ethnic groups, certain religions," he said.
According to Niken, these signs are the beginning of radicalization, where intolerant attitude grows, does not want to respect others and does not want to respect each other.
"For that, we must realize that Indonesia is a Unity in Diversity, many tribes, many religions, many races, many groups living together, because that is Indonesia, we need to join hands to maintain the unity and integrity of the nation," said Niken. ** *
